examples.circuits

Class Triangle.IsValidTriangle

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.uqac.lif.dag.Node
      • ca.uqac.lif.dag.NestedNode
        • ca.uqac.lif.petitpoucet.function.Circuit
          • examples.circuits.Triangle.IsValidTriangle
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Connectable, Contextualizable, ExplanationQueryable, Function, Queryable, Duplicable
    Enclosing class:
    Triangle

    public static class Triangle.IsValidTriangle
extends Circuit
    Determines if a vector contains the lengths of sides of a valid triangle. This global circuit itself refers to multiple other circuits (also defined in this file: Triangle.AllNumbers, Triangle.TriangleInequality, AllPositive). If one expands all these circuits, it results in the following graphical representation:

    The input of the circuit is the pin labeled "A", and its output is "B".
